channel.title: Remove item from player [PI]
channel.description: Ok so I've searched everywhere and no one has this, At all.. I am not looking for an economy reset. I've searched google, google,mopar, google... ect... nothing not even a little hint of anything.. So... What I am trying to do is when a player dies and has certain items they get deleted like not just put on the ground but completely deleted from the player. So please help! I'm using a Pi base Atm (Project Insanity).

item.title: Remove item from player [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

[quote=“yo dude 1345, post:6, topic:405941”][quote author=Mendorphins link=topic=502934.msg3679485#msg3679485 date=1311443039]

public void checkItems() {

        if ((playerHasItem(4151) || (playerHasItem(1040)) {
                deleteItem(4151, 1);
                deleteItem(1040, 1);
        }
}

[/quote]

would this code go under “applydead” or the “Public void dropitems”?[/quote]
You’ll have to re-write the snippet yourself. I don’t know the methods so you’ll have search your code for the right ones. This is a void, so you’ll have to place it anywhere within the class body.

Then use “checkItems();” to use that void in applyDead().

It was just a rough idea for you to work it out.

Read full topic

item.title: Remove item from player [PI]
item.dc:creator: @yo_dude_1345 yo dude 1345
item.description:
@yo_dude_1345 wrote:

[quote=“Mendorphins, post:5, topic:405941”][code=java]
public void checkItems() {

    if ((playerHasItem(4151) || (playerHasItem(1040)) {
            deleteItem(4151, 1);
            deleteItem(1040, 1);
    }

}
[/code][/quote]

would this code go under “applydead” or the “Public void dropitems”?

Read full topic

item.title: Remove item from player [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

If your applyDead method has more than 1 stage, on the first stage you could do a checkItems(); check, and then create a void that goes something like

public void checkItems() {

        if ((playerHasItem(4151) || (playerHasItem(1040)) {
                deleteItem(4151, 1);
                deleteItem(1040, 1);
        }
}

Then call it using checkItems(); on the first stage of a players death. Cheap way and I don’t know your methods and you’ll have to see what actually works, this way just an idea so you could grasp the concept of it.

I’ll give a more professional suggestion after I get my OOP Java degree, hehe.

I was gonna use a “for” check, but I would be a while longer and I can’t be bothered to really do my research arm.

Read full topic
